alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 7:32PM MDT until August 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... SPECIFICALLY FOR SOUTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF ZION NATIONAL PARK... At 732 PM MDT, Zion National Park Dispatch reported flash flooding occurring in Pine Creek slot canyon. Doppler radar indicated between .40-.70" of rain fell upstream over Keyhole Canyon and Clear Creek from an earlier thunderstorm. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, and creeks Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
